alert.note: Alert for Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 09 at 7:36PM CDT until August 11 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Ongoing flooding of area creeks, streams, flood prone and low lying areas. * WHERE...Stephenson County in Northwest Illinois. * WHEN...Until 600 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of area roads, creeks, streams and other low-lying areas continues. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Some areas have seen water levels decrease, while others have seen small increases. This is expected to continue through at least Wednesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 719 PM CDT, Emergency management officials reported ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 7 and 12 inches of rain have fallen. - Emergency management officials reported that Business Highway 20 in Freeport has been reopened due to flooding. Route 75 east of Freeport, and route 73 between Pearl City and Lena remain closed. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Freeport, Lena, Pearl City, Cedarville, Davis, Dakota, German Valley, Winslow, Rock City, Ridott, Buena Vista, Loran, Rock Grove, Oneco, Orangeville - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Don`t drive into flooded roadways and heed all road closures. Don`t become a statistic, turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
